tasks.title: Project Setup with React, Vite, and TailwindCSS
tasks.description: Initialize the project with the required tech stack and configure the development environment.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Vite project with React template: `npm create vite@latest gallery-app --template react`
2. Navigate to project directory: `cd gallery-app`
3. Install dependencies: `npm install`
4. Install and configure TailwindCSS:
   - `npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer`
   - `npx tailwindcss init -p`
   - Configure content paths in tailwind.config.js
   - Add Tailwind directives to index.css
5. Set up project structure:
   - src/components/ (for UI components)
   - src/context/ (for state management)
   - src/data/ (for mock data)
   - src/pages/ (for main pages)
   - src/assets/ (for static assets)
6. Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality
7. Set up Git repository and initial commit
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the development server runs without errors using `npm run dev`. Ensure that TailwindCSS is properly configured by testing a simple component with Tailwind classes. Check that the project structure is correctly set up and all dependencies are installed.

tasks.title: Create Mock Data Structure
tasks.description: Define and implement the data structure for student websites with mock data for development.
tasks.details:
1. Create a JSON file in src/data/websites.json with the following structure:
```json
[
  {
    "id": "unique-id-1",
    "title": "Project Title",
    "creator": "Student Name",
    "description": "Detailed project description",
    "thumbnailUrl": "https://example.com/thumbnail.jpg",
    "websiteUrl": "https://example.com/student-project",
    "techStack": ["React", "TailwindCSS", "Firebase"],
    "createdAt": "2023-11-01"
  },
  // Add at least 10 mock entries
]
```
2. Create a data access layer in src/data/dataService.js to provide functions for:
   - getWebsites(): Get all websites
   - getWebsiteById(id): Get a specific website
   - addWebsite(website): Add a new website
   - searchWebsites(query): Search websites by keyword
   - filterWebsites(filters): Filter websites by criteria
tasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests for the data service functions to ensure they correctly retrieve, filter, and manipulate the mock data. Verify that the mock data structure includes all required fields and has sufficient variety for testing different UI scenarios.

tasks.title: Implement Basic Layout and Navigation
tasks.description: Create the main application layout with header, footer, and navigation components.
tasks.details:
1. Create a Layout component (src/components/Layout.jsx) that includes:
   - Header with app title/logo
   - Main content area
   - Footer with basic information
2. Implement responsive navigation in Header component:
   - Desktop: Horizontal menu
   - Mobile: Hamburger menu with slide-out navigation
3. Include navigation links:
   - Gallery (Home)
   - Submit Website
   - About/Info
4. Use TailwindCSS for styling with a clean, modern aesthetic
5. Ensure the layout is responsive using Tailwind's responsive utilities
6. Implement React Router for navigation between pages:
```jsx
import { BrowserRouter, Routes, Route } from 'react-router-dom';

function App() {
  return (
    <BrowserRouter>
      <Layout>
        <Routes>
          <Route path="/" element={<GalleryPage />} />
          <Route path="/submit" element={<SubmitPage />} />
          <Route path="/about" element={<AboutPage />} />
          <Route path="/website/:id" element={<WebsiteDetailPage />} />
        </Routes>
      </Layout>
    </BrowserRouter>
  );
}
```
tasks.testStrategy: Test the layout on different screen sizes to ensure responsiveness. Verify that navigation works correctly between different pages. Check that the header and footer are consistently displayed across all pages. Test the mobile navigation menu functionality.

tasks.title: Implement State Management with React Context
tasks.description: Set up a state management solution using React Context API for managing application state.
tasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests for the context provider to ensure it correctly manages state. Test the context functions (addNewWebsite, search, filter) to verify they update the state as expected. Test the custom hooks in isolation to ensure they provide the correct data to components.

tasks.title: Implement Gallery Grid Component
tasks.description: Create a responsive grid component to display student website thumbnails in the gallery view.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the gallery grid with different numbers of items to ensure proper layout. Verify responsiveness across different screen sizes. Test loading states, error states, and empty states. Check that hover effects and transitions work correctly. Verify that clicking on a card navigates to the correct detail page.

tasks.title: Implement Website Detail Modal/Page
tasks.description: Create a detailed view for individual student websites with comprehensive information and external link.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the detail page with different website data to ensure all information is displayed correctly. Verify that the external link works properly. Test responsiveness on different screen sizes. If implementing a modal version, test opening and closing animations and ensure it works correctly when triggered from the gallery.

tasks.title: Implement Website Submission Form
tasks.description: Create a form for students to submit their website information to the gallery.
tasks.testStrategy: Test form validation by submitting with empty fields and invalid data. Verify that error messages are displayed correctly. Test successful form submission and check that the new website appears in the gallery. Test URL validation for thumbnail and website URLs. Verify that the form is responsive on different screen sizes.

tasks.title: Implement Search and Filter Functionality
tasks.description: Create components for searching and filtering websites by keywords, creator names, and tech stack.
tasks.testStrategy: Test search functionality with various keywords to ensure it returns the correct results. Test filtering by different tech stack options and verify that the correct websites are displayed. Test the combination of search and filters to ensure they work together correctly. Verify that the UI updates appropriately when search/filter criteria change.

tasks.title: Implement Responsive Design
tasks.description: Ensure the application is fully responsive and provides an optimal experience across all device sizes.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the application on various devices and screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop). Verify that all components adjust appropriately to different screen sizes. Check that touch interactions work correctly on mobile devices. Ensure that text is readable and buttons are easily tappable on small screens. Test navigation functionality across all device sizes.

tasks.title: Implement About/Info Page
tasks.description: Create an informational page about the gallery project, its purpose, and how to use it.
tasks.details:
1. Create an AboutPage component (src/pages/AboutPage.jsx): ```jsx function AboutPage() { return (

Ensure that the page is accessible according to WCAG standards. Verify that the page is correctly linked from the navigation menu.

tasks.title: Add Loading States and Error Handling
tasks.description: Implement loading indicators and error handling throughout the application for a better user experience.
tasks.testStrategy: Test loading states by simulating slow network connections. Verify that loading indicators are displayed during data fetching operations. Test error handling by simulating various error conditions (network errors, validation errors, etc.). Verify that error messages are displayed correctly and that retry functionality works as expected. Test error boundaries by intentionally causing component errors.

tasks.title: Configure Deployment to Static Hosting
tasks.description: Prepare the application for deployment to a static hosting service like Vercel or Netlify.
tasks.details:
1. Optimize the build for production:
   - Run `npm run build` to create an optimized production build
   - Verify that the build completes successfully and check the output size

2. Configure environment variables if needed:
   - Create a `.env` file for development
   - Set up environment variables in the hosting platform

3. Set up deployment to Vercel:
   - Install Vercel CLI: `npm i -g vercel`
   - Create a `vercel.json` configuration file if needed
   - Deploy using: `vercel` or connect to GitHub repository for automatic deployments

4. Alternative: Set up deployment to Netlify:
   - Create a `netlify.toml` configuration file:
   ```toml
   [build]
     publish = "dist"
     command = "npm run build"

   [[redirects]]
     from = "/*"
     to = "/index.html"
     status = 200
   ```
   - Deploy using Netlify CLI or connect to GitHub repository

5. Configure custom domain (optional):
   - Add a custom domain in the hosting platform settings
   - Configure DNS settings with your domain provider
   - Set up HTTPS

6. Set up continuous deployment:
   - Connect the hosting platform to your GitHub repository
   - Configure automatic deployments on push to main/master branch
   - Set up preview deployments for pull requests

7. Test the deployed application:
   - Verify all features work correctly in the production environment
   - Test on multiple devices and browsers
   - Check performance using Lighthouse or similar tools
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the production build completes successfully. Test the deployed application to ensure all features work correctly in the production environment. Test routing to make sure all routes are accessible directly (not just through navigation). Check performance metrics using Lighthouse. Verify that the application works correctly on multiple devices and browsers.
